title: Grassroots Ascendancy
outcome: Neighborhood assemblies and community leaders take control of essential services in the power vacuum left by the discredited Council. Grassroots networks organize food, resource distribution, and public safety. While some districts flourish, others fall into rivalries or scarcity as the lack of centralized BCI leads to black markets and old grudges resurfacing. Oksana and Sven try to guide the transition, but without clear authority, chaos and innovation spread across Stenograd.

events.description: Grassroots district meetings establish rotating councils for food and public order as Council leadership falters. Ordinary citizens visibly lead daily coordination efforts.
Old Rivalries resurface in several sectors as resource hoarding and accusations of favoritism break out. Vigilante justice briefly flares before community mediators intervene.
An underground barter market thrives in low-resource neighborhoods. 'Vanished' citizens are seen openly organizing distribution lines and providing medical aid.
Oksana and Sven convene a citywide gathering online, urging harmonization of district rules. Their leadership is contested by some local strongmen who refuse outside guidance.
Several districts unite in a federation for mutual aid, publishing an open manifesto for city reform and a transparent, people-led replacement for the BCI.
